pr_title: Return TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE from Prometheus connector

timeline.author: electrum

timeline.bodyText: You can use ZoneOffset.UTC which is a ZoneId
timeline.author: electrum

timeline.bodyText: This seems strange the data is coming from a different system (unlikely JMX where it's local to that JVM). Using session time zone seems better. Though in practice these are likely to be the same.
timeline.author: electrum

replies.bodyText: I think it should either be JVM or a configuration.  We can add a configuration later if people want.
replies.author: dain

timeline.author: electrum

timeline.bodyText:
We should get rid of this usage of org.apache.http.client.utils.URIBuilder. There's another PR #4698 to use Airlift HTTP client.
return new URI(uri.getScheme(), uri.getAuthority(), uri.getPath() + METRICS_ENDPOINT, null, null);
timeline.author: electrum
electrum
electrum

timeline.bodyText:
Let's make this
throw new PrestoException(PROMETHEUS_UNKNOWN_ERROR, "Failed to read bearer token file: " + tokenFileName, e);
